justification: “We use the GMH statistic to test whether an algorithm has DAF or not across all intersectional subgroups simultaneously.”
“Using (3), we can detect DAF, uniform DAF, and nonuniform DAF.”

measured_by: Regularized Group Differential Algorithmic Functioning method (rgDAF)
justification: “We propose an approach based on regularized group regression to detect the composite effect of DAF and specific types of DAF.”
Table 3 lists the null and alternative hypotheses for ‘Uniform DAF’ detected with the GLR_UNI test based on Model (3).
The text states that GLR_NUNI is used to test for ‘nonuniform DAF’ by comparing slopes in Model (3).
“Based on Model (4), we can detect the presence of interactive DAF… the test statistic is denoted as GLR INT.”
Table 4 specifies a single penalized coefficient group β₁ for detecting ‘Uniform DAF’ with the rgDAF_UNI procedure.
Table 4 shows that J−1 separate coefficient groups (β₂1 … β₂,J-1) are penalised to detect ‘Nonuniform DAF’ via rgDAF_NUNI.
“In the case of interactive DAF, if any coefficient in β₃ … does not shrink to 0, it supports the presence of interactive DAF,” describing the rgDAF_INT test.
